thread.title: How much does Ray Parlour remember about Arsenal's Invincibles? We test Gunners legend on the 2003/04 season
thread.title_full: How much does Ray Parlour remember about Arsenal's Invincibles? We test Gunners legend on the 2003/04 season

author: Richard Innes
title: How much does Ray Parlour remember about Arsenal's Invincibles? We test Gunners legend on the 2003/04 season
text:
Sport How much does Ray Parlour remember about Arsenal's Invincibles? We test Gunners legend on the 2003/04 season EXCLUSIVE! We ask the Romford Pele 10 questions about Arsenal's infamous undefeated season… and find out his memory isn't as good as you might think Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Arsenal   
Ray Parlour was part of the most successful, most famous season any Arsenal team has ever had. 
For those of you new to the sport of football, that side was Arsenal's Invincibles of 2003/04 - the squad who won the Premier League without losing a single game. 
It was perhaps the most impressive achievement in English football history, achieved by a group of amazing players that included the likes of Thierry Henry, Patrick Vieira and Robert Pires. Ray Parlour and some bloke who played up front (Photo: Reuters) 
So, given that being part of that squad was undoubtedly the pinnacle of his career, how much do you think Parlour - a veteran midfielder back in 2003/04 - remembers about that glorious season? 
A lot, right? After all, most fans probably presume that players involved in something that amazing can recall every last detail of it. 
Take a look at the video above (filmed at a Ladbrokes event) and you will soon see that Parlour's recollection is not quite as good as that. Two midfielders no-one fancied facing (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
In fairness to the man known as The Romford Pele, the 10 questions we asked him were far from easy. We grill him on the players who were sent off that season, their biggest win of the campaign and the player who was Arsenal's SECOND top goalscorer that year (because even your mum knows Thierry Henry was top of the list). 
Ray gets a fair few right. But as some of his answers confirm, supporters tend to be much better than players at remembering their team's history… Like us on Facebook
